question: The negation of the statement "For every real number x; <katex>$x^{2}+5$</katex> is positive" is
choices: For every real number x; <katex>$x^{2}+5$</katex> is not positive
For every real number x; <katex>$x^{2}+5$</katex> is negative
There exists at least one real number x such that <katex>$x^{2}+5$</katex> is not positive
There exists at least one real number x such that <katex>$x^{2}+5$</katex> is positive
explanation: The negation of a universal quantifier ('For every') is an existential quantifier ('There exists') with the negation of the predicate.
